definition: regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
lit. like a monk holding an umbrella — no hair, no sky (idiom) (punning on 髮|发[fa4] vs 法[fa3])/fig. defying the law and the principles of heaven/lawless
pinyin: he2 shang5 da3 san3 , wu2 fa3 wu2 tian1

sentences.english: She was the mother of two peremptory little boys.
sentences.chinese: 她现在已是两个无法无天的小男孩的母亲。

sentences.english: Catching up with these outlaws is harder than expected however.
sentences.chinese: 要找到这些“无法无天”的人比想象要难。

sentences.english: Their films exude a tone oflawlessness and despair.
sentences.chinese: 他们的作品流露出一种无法无天和绝望的气氛。

sentences.english: Right now it's a domain of lawlessness.
sentences.chinese: 现在这是个无法无天的领域。

sentences.english: Is lawlessness in the area of property companies can?
sentences.chinese: 难道在小区中物业公司就能无法无天吗？

sentences.english: It is lawless right now in the Wild West.
sentences.chinese: 现在的西部简直无法无天。

sentences.english: This is called a licentiousness not to be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 这就叫无法无天，是不能忍受的。

definition: see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
